pullRequest.body:
This converts usages of the pattern
```lean
cases h
case inl h' => ...
case inr h' => ...
```
which derive from mathported code, to the "structured `cases`" syntax:
```lean
cases h with
| inl h' => ...
| inr h' => ...
```
The case where the subgoals are handled with `Â·` instead of `case` is more contentious (and much more numerous) so I left those alone. This pattern also appears with `cases'`, `induction`, `induction'`, and `rcases`. Furthermore, there is a similar transformation for `by_cases`:
```lean
by_cases h : cond
case pos => ...
case neg => ...
```
is replaced by:
```lean
if h : cond then
  ...
else
  ...
```

---

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

nodes.body:
Here are the [benchmark results](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/run-detail/78623df9-2c2a-4b7c-ac31-abab7e0c2b5d) for commit 2581c17a34a1b0412368f27de778634246f050fa.
There were [no significant changes](http://speed.lean-fro.org/mathlib4/compare/5174db72-ccb0-4124-b773-a1c56f3e07ac/to/78623df9-2c2a-4b7c-ac31-abab7e0c2b5d) against commit 6cab3d646c38b08ac405dd08d69f9cd87938b5c1.
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by alexjbest.
Btw, to what extent was this automatically generated?
Not at all, although I did think about ways this kind of thing might be automated in the future.

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7354607552/job/20022044558)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7354607552/job/20022044181)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7354607552/job/20022044339)
Can we use `induction .. generalizing` instead of `revert; induction` here? Or you prefer to leave it to another PR?
sure, we can remove all the `intro` as well.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - style: use `cases x with | ...` instead of `cases x; case => ...`
